intro: Racosperma phaeocalyx, commonly known as the grey-flowered acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds, typical of the legume family. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Racosperma phaeocalyx plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects and small animals.
